title: Installation issue: moab
body:
variant moab+cgm is not building anymore

moab still uses *.la libtool library files to resolve dependencies 

So `spack spec moab+cgm` works as expected, but 
`spack install moab+cgm` does not, with compile errors related to missing *.la files in cgm installation. Looking at the cgm build, I see that the *la files are built, but they are not installed anymore in cgm installation folder, in spack; 

moab build:
[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5697791/spack-build-out.txt)

In the corresponding spack-build-out file for cgm, I do see that the libcgm.la file is "created", and installed, but I assume something in spack removes them after that

libtool: install: /usr/bin/install -c .libs/libcgm.lai /media/iulian/ExtraDrive1/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake/gcc-7.5.0/cgm-16.0-ygl2gpl46w5k5wzhpsqoye4trts5nbom/lib/libcgm.la

cgm build:
[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5697818/spack-build-out.txt)

So can we still use *la files or not anymore ? we think the long term solution is to use *.pc files (pkg-config), that seems to be supported by spack (and encouraged? ) 

Or is it possible for a quick fix to still install *.la files ? 

- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
